snippet: A small but growing number of teenage girls in Europe, enticed by Internet recruiters, have shown amazing determination in their efforts to join jihadists, experts say.
abstract: French officials say they believe Muslim girl from Bethoncourt, France, who has disappeared and is believed to be en route to Syria, is one of small but growing number of adolescent girls who have shown remarkable determination in their efforts to join Islamic jihadists; problem appears most severe in France, which has large Muslim population from Middle East and North Africa.

byline.original: By SUZANNE DALEY and MAÏA de la BAUME

lead_paragraph: A small but growing number of teenage girls in Europe, enticed by Internet recruiters, have shown amazing determination in their efforts to join jihadists, experts say.

headline.main: A French Town Reels After Teenage Girl Vanishes, Apparently to Join Jihadists
headline.print_headline: French Town Reels After a Girl Vanishes, Apparently to Join Jihadists

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
